intro: Boscia foetida subsp. minima, commonly known as the dwarf bosco, is a small shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, rounded leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by small, fleshy fruits that are edible for certain animals. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in ecological studies.
